news.title: Rule that patients must finish antibiotics course is wrong, study says
news.summary: Telling patients to stop taking antibiotics when they feel better may be preferable to instructing them to finish the course, according to a group of experts who argue that the rule long embedded in the minds of doctors and the public is wrong and…

news.title: No need to finish antibiotics?
news.summary: © PA The experts say there is too little research into the best length of course of antibiotics.

news.title: Os antibióticos são sempre para tomar até ao fim. Ou não?
news.summary: Seguramente, todos nós já fomos alertados pelo nosso médico de que temos de tomar o antibiótico até ao fim, não antecipando assim o fim do tratamento.

news.title: New study suggests shorter duration of antibiotic therapy is preferable and less likely to fuel drug resistance
news.summary: © Julien Behal/PA Experts suggest patients should stop taking the drugs when they feel better rather than completing their prescription.

news.title: Seguire scrupolosamente la terapia favorisce l’antibiotico-resistenza? - Galileo
news.summary: 28 luglio 2017 - - Stampa Uno studio pubblicato sul Bmj mette in discussione le regole sul corretto utilizzo degli antibiotici: portare sempre a termine i cicli di trattamento potrebbe favorire lo sviluppo di antibiotico-resistenza.

news.title: Tell it to me straight, doctor. Why openness from public health experts is so important | Robin Bisson
news.summary: Many people might be relieved to hear the news that by not finishing a prescription of antibiotics, we’re not accelerating the rise of drug-resistant bacteria.
